decks.notes: This deck focuses on maximizing the strength of Human creatures by playing a combination of powerful synergistic cards like Champion of the Parish, Thalia's Lieutenant, and Mayor of Avabruck. By utilizing Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play and disrupt opponents with cards like Reflector Mage and Kitesail Freebooter, the deck aims to win the game quickly through aggro play. The efficient mana base and use of Cavern of Souls helps ensure that the deck can consistently cast its creatures while applying pressure to the opponent.

The main focus of the deck is to quickly and efficiently deliver poison counters to the opponent using infect creatures like Blighted Agent and Glistener Elf. The deck includes a variety of pump spells such as Scale Up, Might of Old Krosa, and Mutagenic Growth to increase the power of these creatures and finish off the opponent with poison counters. In addition, protection spells like Apostle's Blessing and Blossoming Defense are included to ensure the creatures can get through and deal damage. The deck also includes some disruption in the form of Spell Pierce and Dismember to help control the game.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly through cards like Azusa, Lost but Seeking and Amulet of Vigor, allowing the player to play large threats like Primeval Titan early on. The key combo involves using Amulet of Vigor to untap lands that come into play, creating a loop that allows the player to quickly generate mana and set up a powerful board state. Other cards like Hive Mind and Pact of Negation help protect the combo and ensure its success. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its powerful creatures and combo potential.

This deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with spells and then utilizing them to bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard. It also uses cards like Thing in the Ice and Aria of Flame to quickly apply pressure and finish off the opponent. The deck has a low mana curve to ensure fast deployment of threats and uses cantrips like Serum Visions and Sleight of Hand to filter through the deck and find the necessary pieces for its game plan. Surgical Extraction is included to disrupt the opponent's strategy by removing key cards from their graveyard.

This deck focuses on playing powerful Eldrazi creatures quickly to overwhelm the opponent and disrupt their strategy. It combines aggressive creatures like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer with disruptive elements like Chalice of the Void and Karn, the Great Creator to control the game. The deck also includes key colorless lands like Eldrazi Temple and Urza's lands to help ramp up mana and cast the high-cost Eldrazi creatures. The strategy is to disrupt the opponent's game plan while deploying quickly growing threats to end the game.

The deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to control the board and apply pressure on the opponent. By combining cards that force discards, removal spells, and powerful planeswalkers such as Liliana of the Veil and Wrenn and Six, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while deploying threats like Tarmogoyf and Bloodbraid Elf to quickly close out the game. The mana base is designed to support the deck's aggressive game plan while also providing flexibility and consistency in casting spells.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize powerful Eldrazi creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. With cards like Karn, the Great Creator and Reality Smasher, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while dealing consistent damage. Chalice of the Void and All Is Dust provide additional disruption, while cards like Expedition Map and Urza's lands ensure consistency in mana production. Overall, the deck focuses on fast aggression and disruption to control the game and come out on top in 1 vs 1 Modern matches.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful Eldrazi creatures and disrupt their strategy with cards like Chalice of the Void and Karn, the Great Creator. The deck aims to quickly establish a board presence with cards like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer, while using cards like Warping Wail and Dismember to control the board. Additionally, the deck includes lands like Eldrazi Temple and Urza's Tower to ramp into the big Eldrazi threats early in the game.

This Modern UW Control deck focuses on utilizing a combination of counterspells, removal, card advantage, and powerful planeswalkers to control the game and outvalue the opponent. The deck aims to slow down the opponent's game plan, answer threats efficiently, and generate card advantage through card draw and planeswalkers' abilities. By carefully managing resources and timing spells effectively, the deck seeks to outlast the opponent and win through attrition, ultimately establishing dominance and closing out the game with a strong board presence and card advantage.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly using Eldrazi temples and Urza lands to cast powerful creatures like Thought-Knot Seer, Reality Smasher, and Ulamog. Chalice of the Void and Karn, the Great Creator disrupt opponent's strategies, while Blast Zone and All Is Dust help with board control. Walking Ballista and Mind Stone provide additional utility and flexibility. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with fast, efficient plays and big threats, aiming to win the game quickly before the opponent can stabilize.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with cards through self-mill effects like Stitcher's Supplier and Insolent Neonate, as well as discarding cards with Faithless Looting. This allows you to efficiently recur creatures like Gravecrawler, Bloodghast, and Vengevine to overwhelm your opponent. The deck aims to create a powerful board presence and generate value from sacrificing creatures with Altar of Dementia and Carrion Feeder. The combination of graveyard synergies and recursive threats makes this deck a formidable force in Modern 1 vs 1 matches.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game using UrzaTron lands to generate a lot of mana and play powerful threats such as Karn, the Great Creator and Walking Ballista. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with counterspells like Condescend and Remand, and artifacts like Chalice of the Void. The deck also includes utility cards like Academy Ruins and Tolaria West to search for key pieces. Overall, the strategy is to outvalue and outlast the opponent by leveraging strong control elements and versatile threats.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly generate mana through spells like Pyretic Ritual and Desperate Ritual, while using cards like Goblin Electromancer and Baral, Chief of Compliance to reduce the cost of spells and draw through the deck efficiently. The deck then aims to cast Gifts Ungiven to search for combo pieces like Past in Flames and Grapeshot, which can be used to generate a large amount of storm count and burn the opponent out in a single turn. The deck is centered around storming off and overwhelming the opponent with a flurry of spells in a single turn.

The deck focuses on quickly casting spells to trigger prowess abilities on creatures like Soul-Scar Mage and Monastery Swiftspear, while also using cards like Faithless Looting and Light Up the Stage to dig for more spells. The ultimate goal is to bring back Arclight Phoenix from the graveyard by casting multiple spells in a turn, overwhelming the opponent with aggressive plays and burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Spike. The deck aims to close out games quickly with a combination of cheap spells and evasive threats.

The main focus of this Modern 1 vs 1 Eldrazi Aggro deck is to quickly ramp up mana using Tron lands and Eldrazi Temple, then play efficient threats like Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher to disrupt the opponent's game plan and apply pressure. Karn, the Great Creator provides additional utility and disruption with access to sideboard cards from the sideboard. Chalice of the Void helps lock out opponent's spells while Blast Zone and All Is Dust provide board control. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with powerful creatures and disruptive plays.

The main focus of this deck is to ramp up quickly using Urza lands and Eldrazi Temple to bring out powerful creatures like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer. The inclusion of Karn, the Great Creator allows for additional flexibility and disruption with cards like Chalice of the Void and Blast Zone. With the ability to disrupt opponent strategies while rapidly building a threatening board presence, this Aggro-Eldrazi deck aims to overwhelm opponents and close out games quickly.
